title: UPDATE: Suspect in Rochester homicide facing new charge
content:
Please install the latest Adobe Flash Player Plugin to watch this content.
UPDATE: Abdulkadir Mohamed, 30, is now being charged with second-degree unintentional murder after the shooting death of 31-year-old Abdullahi Omar Sheikh last week.
Authorities say he was handling a gun that fired inside a car and struck Sheikh. Despite being just a block away from the emergency room, he died from a single gunshot wound to the torso.
Investigators say both men were friends and they don’t believe he meant to kill the man.
This was Rochester’s second homicide of the year.
Previous coverage below.
ROCHESTER, Minn. – Rochester police say the man detained Wednesday after a fatal shooting is now facing charges of second-degree manslaughter and reckless discharge of a firearm.
Abdulkadir Mohamed, 30, was arrested at the scene after police say another suspect fled.
At this point, investigators think these three men were friends and went out to downtown bars carrying a handgun. When they supposedly had a fight, the gun went off in the backseat where Mohamed was, piercing the driver’s seat and killing 31-year-old Abdullahi Omar Sheikh.
On Wednesday night, officers found the third man who was in the car at the time — at this point, he’s only a witness.
Police are still looking for a piece of evidence — a gray Georgetown Hoyas basketball jersey. They think it may be in the area from 16th Ave. to Fourth Avenue, between Seventh Street and Second Street.
Previous coverage below.
Please install the latest Adobe Flash Player Plugin to watch this content.
ROCHESTER, Minn. – Police are asking for the public’s help in Wednesday’s fatal shooting.
Residents in the Kutzky and Cooke Park neighborhoods are being asked to check their yards for discarded clothing. Rochester police say there are particularly looking for a gray Georgetown Hoyas basketball jersey. They think it may be in the area from 16th Avenue to 4th Avenue, between 7th street and 2nd street.
Anyone who locates an item of clothing is asked to immediately call (507) 328-6800.
The Rochester Police Department also says it has accounted for all the people who were in the vehicle with Abdullahi Omar Sheikh before he was shot to death. No arrests have been made but the investigation continues.
UPDATE: Rochester police have identified the victim in Wednesday morning’s shooting as Abdullahi Omar Sheikh, 31, of Rochester.
ROCHESTER, Minn. – One man is in custody and police are searching for a second suspect after investigators say a 31-year-old man was shot while driving early Wednesday morning.
Officers arrived at the intersection of 14th Ave. And Second Street SW just before 2:30 a.m. to respond to a crash. While police were on their way, witnesses told them two men were trying to drag a third out of the vehicle.
By the time they got there, the victim was unresponsive and suffering from a single gunshot wound to the upper torso. CPR was performed before the man was taken to the hospital and pronounced dead. At this time, investigators believe he was shot while driving, causing the crash.
Police arrested 30-year-old Abdulkadir Mohamed, of Rochester, at the scene for a felony warrant out of Goodhue County. Another passenger fled before officers arrived, witnesses told police.
Investigators found a handgun at the scene and an autopsy is being done Wednesday.
This is Rochester’s second homicide investigation this year.
Stay with KIMT and install our free app for the latest on the investigation.
Previous coverage below.
UPDATE: Traffic is opening back up at 15th Ave. SW. We expect to learn more about the investigation by 8:30 a.m.
ROCHESTER, Minn. – The Rochester Police Department is investigating a suspicious death at one of the busiest intersections in town.
The intersection at 14th Ave. and 2nd St. SW will be closed until at least 6:15 a.m. because it is an active crime scene.
So far it has been confirmed that an adult male has died from a gunshot wound at the hospital.
At this time, no other information is being released. Stay with KIMT for the latest details.
